title: IntegerValidator
description: A validator specifying the constraints on an integer node.
$comment:
A node will be valid if it is a number with no
fractional part and meets any additional constraints, such as `multipleOf`,
specified in the validator.
Analogous to the JSON Schema `integer` validation [type](https://json-schema.org/draft/2019-09/json-schema-validation.html#rfc.section.6.1.1).

minimum.description: The inclusive lower limit for a numeric node.
minimum.$comment: A number is valid if it is greater than, or exactly equal to, `minimum`.

exclusiveMinimum.description: The exclusive lower limit for a numeric node.
exclusiveMinimum.$comment: A number is valid only if it has a value greater than (not equal to) `exclusiveMinimum`.

maximum.description: The inclusive upper limit for a numeric node.
maximum.$comment: A number is valid if it is less than, or exactly equal to, `maximum`.

exclusiveMaximum.description: The exclusive upper limit for a numeric node.
exclusiveMaximum.$comment: A number is valid only if it has a value less than (not equal to) `exclusiveMaximum`.

multipleOf.description: A number that a numeric node must be a multiple of.
multipleOf.$comment: A number is valid only if division by this value results in an integer.
